page.title: GalaxyTrader MK3
page.t: Dock at station and wait for specified duration
Take final examination for pilot certification at training facility
Advanced trading system with XP progression and fleet coordination
Choose home sector or station where trader operates
Maximum jump gate distance when buying wares (limited by pilot skill)
Maximum jump gate distance when selling wares (limited by pilot skill)
Automatic selection of suitable wares based on category
Manual selection of specific trading wares
Allow trading in contraband and illegal goods
Security tolerance: 0.0=Only safe sectors, 1.0=Accept all risks
Improve pilot skills through trading experience
Automatically send pilots for training when needed
Coordinate multiple trading ships to avoid conflicts
Target cargo utilization percentage before prioritizing sales
How often market data and price information is updated
Share profitable trade routes with fleet (cached for quick access)
Minimum profit required to cache trade and share with fleet
Maximum profit decline allowed before cached trade routes become invalid
How long cached trade routes remain valid before expiring
Enable detailed logging of individual trade evaluations and rejections (can be very verbose)
Enable per-trade logbook entries and immersive training messages (TaterTrader style)
Sectors in this list are excluded from blacklists (always allowed)
Exclude carriers and auxiliary ships from trading
Exclude build storage ships from trading
Ignore station trade rules during offer search (advanced; may select offers normally blocked)
%s needs training! Please send to nearest shipyard or trading station.
%s has completed training and is now certified for level %s!
%s has completed a trade! Profit: %s Cr
%s has found a profitable trade route!
No profitable trade routes available for %s
Selling %1 %2 from cargo at %3. I should earn %4 in profit.
Queuing up trade order for %1 %2. Buying at %3 to sell at %4. I should earn %5 in profit.
Station Trader: Selling %1 %2 at the price of %3. Expected profit is %4.
Trade completed successfully for %1 %2. Total profit: %3 Credits.
Trade route cached: %1 %2 from %3 to %4 (Profit: %5 Cr)
\nTotal estimated lifetime profit before this trade: %1 Cr.

Hello Commander %1,

I have gained enough experience to take my certification exam for the title "%2". The examination will take approximately %3 minutes at %4.

This is an important milestone in my career development. The exam will test my knowledge of advanced trading protocols, market analysis, and fleet coordination procedures.

I'm confident in my abilities and excited to prove myself worthy of this advancement. Wish me luck!

Respectfully,
%5
Aboard %6

Commander %1,

Excellent news! I have successfully completed my certification examination and earned the title "%2"!

The examination covered advanced trading strategies, risk assessment protocols, and fleet coordination procedures. I'm pleased to report that I passed with distinction.

I'm now qualified to handle more complex trading operations and look forward to contributing even more to our fleet's success. Thank you for investing in my professional development.

With renewed dedication,
%3
Certified %2
Aboard %4

Commander %1,

I regret to inform you that my certification exam was interrupted due to operational requirements. I will need to reschedule when circumstances permit.

I remain committed to advancing my skills and will notify you when I can resume the examination process.

Respectfully,
%2
Aboard %3

Commander %1,

I am currently en route to %2 for my certification examination. The journey gives me time to review my studies and prepare mentally for this important step in my career.

Expected arrival: %3 minutes
Examination duration: %4 minutes

I appreciate your confidence in my abilities and the opportunity for advancement.

With determination,
%5
Aboard %6

Commander,

I've detected cargo in my hold during my systems check. Before I can begin normal trading operations, I need to sell this merchandise.

I'm using our trade search to find the best buyer and safely offload this cargo. Once my hold is clear, I'll proceed with automated trading.

Status: Searching for optimal sale location

With diligence,
Aboard %1

Commander,

My hull integrity has dropped to %1%% (threshold: %2%%). As a Level %3 pilot, I'm authorized to request auto-repair services.

I'm proceeding to %4 for repair work. The estimated cost is %5 Cr, which is within our budget.

Once repairs are complete, I'll resume trading operations with full structural integrity.

Respectfully,
Aboard %6

Commander,

URGENT FINANCIAL WARNING

My hull integrity is critical at %1%% (threshold: %2%%), but our available funds (%3 Cr) are insufficient for full repairs (estimated cost: %4 Cr).

I'm proceeding to %5 for PARTIAL REPAIRS using our available funds. This isn't an ideal solution, but it's necessary to maintain operational capability.

Please consider allocating additional funds for future maintenance operations.

Concerned but determined,
Aboard %6

Commander,

My Level %1 certification authorizes automatic resupply of defensive equipment. After checking my systems, I've determined that my countermeasures and deployables are below recommended thresholds.

I'm proceeding to %2 to restock my defensive equipment:
• Countermeasures: Replenishing to optimal capacity
• Defense drones, trade drones, laser towers: Applying balance profile

This resupply ensures I'm best protected against space threats while maintaining trading efficiency.

With vigilance,
Aboard %3

Commander,

My hull integrity has dropped to %1%% (threshold: %2%%), and I need repair services. However, the nearest repair station at %3 is currently unreachable due to sector travel restrictions (blacklisted routes).

I will continue with trading operations despite this limitation. Once safe routes become available again, I will automatically seek repair services.

I will monitor the situation and notify you when repairs become possible.

Respectfully,
Aboard %4

Commander,

My defensive equipment requires resupply, but the nearest equipment station at %1 is currently unreachable due to sector travel restrictions (blacklisted routes).

I will continue with trading operations despite this limitation. Once safe routes become available again, I will automatically seek resupply services.

I will monitor the situation and notify you when resupply becomes possible.

Respectfully,
Aboard %2

Commander,

I've completed an exhaustive market analysis of %1 and surrounding sectors (within %2 jumps, minimum profit threshold: %3 Cr), but unfortunately found no profitable trading opportunities that meet our requirements.

TRADE ANALYSIS REPORT:
Total opportunities evaluated: %4

REJECTION BREAKDOWN:
- Docking restrictions: %5 trades
 (Station doesn't permit my ship class)
- Insufficient profitability: %6 trades
 (Below minimum profit threshold)
- Insufficient volume: %7 trades
 (Zero or negative tradeable amount)
- Safety restrictions: %8 trades
 (Blacklisted stations or dangerous sectors)

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Consider adjusting profit thresholds
- Expand maximum trading distance
- Review sector blacklist settings
- Wait for market conditions to improve

I'll continue monitoring the market and will notify you when profitable opportunities become available.

Standing by,
Aboard your service

Commander,

URGENT ROUTE ALERT

My threat intelligence system has detected that sector %1 (threat level %2) is now in my planned trade route. For the safety of the ship and crew, I am immediately aborting the current trade operation.

ACTIONS TAKEN:
- All trade orders cancelled
- Returning to safe operations mode
- Will find alternative trade route that avoids dangerous sectors
- Cargo handling: Automatic (will sell any cargo at safe location if needed)

The dynamic blacklist system will prevent future trades through this sector until the threat is cleared.

Safety is my first priority.

With vigilance,
Aboard %3

Commander,

ESCAPE ROUTE INITIATED

I'm currently in blacklisted sector %1 and have found a trade route that will allow me to escape safely.

TRADE ROUTE:
Buy: %2 (Sector: %3)
Sell: %4 (Sector: %5)
Ware: %6 (x%7)
Expected Profit: %8 Cr

The ship will escape the blacklisted sector after completing this trade.

Respectfully,
Aboard your service

Commander,

ISOLATED TRADING MODE

I'm currently in sector %2, but all routes to other sectors are blocked by blacklisted hub sectors. This means I can only trade within my current sector until the blacklist situation changes.

SITUATION:
Current Sector: %2
Status: Isolated (non-blacklisted sector with blocked routes)
Trading Mode: Intra-sector trades only

My trading system has automatically adjusted profit thresholds to prioritize available intra-sector trading opportunities.

I will continue monitoring the situation and notify you if routes become available again.

Respectfully,
Aboard %1

Commander,

ROUTE PATH CHANGE DETECTED

Upon entering sector %1, my navigation system detected that the route to my destination %2 (%3) has changed.

PATH ANALYSIS:
- Normal distance: %4 jumps
- Blacklist-aware distance: %5
- Status: %6

My navigation computer indicates that the preferred route is no longer viable due to sector travel restrictions. For the safety of the ship and crew, I am immediately aborting the current trade operation.

ACTIONS TAKEN:
- All trade orders cancelled
- Returning to safe operations mode
- Will find alternative trade route that avoids blocked sectors
- Cargo handling: Automatic (will sell any cargo at safe location if needed)

My navigation system will automatically avoid blocked sectors in future route planning.

Safety is my first priority.

With vigilance,
Aboard %7

Commander,

ENEMY SHIP ESCAPED

Our threat intelligence system has lost track of enemy ship %3, which has escaped from blacklisted sector %1.

DETAILS:
- Escaped Ship: %3
- Sector Left: %1
- Destination Sector: %2
- Status: Tracking lost - ship has left our monitored area

While this ship is no longer a threat in sector %1, we have lost visual contact and cannot confirm its current status or intentions in sector %2.

Our tracking systems will continue monitoring sector %1 for remaining threats. If all tracked enemies leave or are eliminated, the sector will be automatically cleared from the blacklist.

With vigilance,
Threat Intelligence System

Commander,

I was unable to find profitable trading opportunities at greater distances (up to %3 jumps) because these routes are currently unreachable due to sector travel restrictions (blacklisted paths).

SITUATION:
Current Sector: %2
Original Search Range: %3 jumps
Fallback Search Range: %4 jumps

I will now focus my search on nearby sectors within %4 jumps, where routes are more likely to be accessible. This should help me find profitable trades that were previously filtered out due to distance restrictions rather than actual unprofitability.

I'll notify you when I find suitable trading opportunities in the nearby area.

Respectfully,
Aboard %1

Commander,

SECTOR BLACKLISTED

Our threat intelligence system has detected hostile activity in sector %1 and has automatically blacklisted this sector to protect our trading operations.

DETECTED ENEMY SHIPS:
%2

For the safety of our ships and crew, all trading routes through this sector have been blocked. Our ships will automatically route around this sector until the threat is eliminated.

The sector will be automatically cleared from the blacklist once all tracked enemy ships are eliminated or leave the area.

With vigilance,
Threat Intelligence System

Commander,

I cannot find an accessible training station for my Level %1 advancement exam. I will proceed with trading operations as instructed, but I understand that I will not gain experience points until I can complete the required training. After this trade run, I will search again for any possible opportunity to train.

Respectfully,
Aboard %2
Bonus: I gained %1 additional skill level%2 from accumulated experience during training! Current level: %3
It is an honor to work for you, %1! I am excited to begin my trading career under your command. I will do my best to serve you well and contribute to your success.

Thank you for giving me this well-deserved holiday, %1! I have enjoyed my time away from trading and my skills remain intact. I am looking forward to returning to work whenever you need me. Until then, I will keep my trading knowledge sharp!
I am back from holiday and ready to work again, %1! My trading skills remain sharp and I am eager to continue serving you on %2. Thank you for the well-deserved rest!

Thank you for my transfer to %1, %2! I am honored by this new assignment and will take excellent care of my new ship. My trading experience and skills remain intact, and I am ready to continue serving you.
Fleet coordination: %s has been assigned route %s
Fleet coordination: Route %s is fully utilized
%s has been assigned as primary territory for %s
Territory bonus applied: %s%% profit increase in %s
Error: %s is stuck and needs assistance!
Error: Cannot register %s with GalaxyTrader MK3
Ware categories updated from current game state
New wares from other mods detected and categorized
When enabled, pilots gain experience from trading and require training at certain levels. When disabled, pilots use native X4 progression.
Automatically sends pilots for training when they reach required levels. Disable to manually control training timing.
Adjusts how fast pilots gain experience. Higher values mean faster progression.
Percentage of subordinate XP awarded to commander pilots. Set to 0% to disable commander bonus XP. Default: 10%.
Enables intelligent fleet coordination features including route optimization and load balancing.
Minimum profit margin required for trades to be cached and shared with fleet. Higher values = more selective caching.
Allows sharing profitable trade opportunities between fleet members for better coordination.
Controls how many notifications are shown: 0=Quiet, 1=Important only, 2=All notifications

Automatically sends ships for repairs after completing trades when hull falls below threshold. Only for experienced pilots (Level 12+). Ships choose appropriate facility: S/M Equipment Dock, L/XL Shipyard.
Hull percentage below which auto-repair is triggered. Default: 95%. Ships will automatically go to nearest repair facility when damaged.
Minimum pilot level required for auto-repair feature. Default: 12 (experienced traders). Lower level pilots must repair manually.
Maximum relative price for sell offers (ship buys FROM stations). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: 0.5 (50% above average). Higher = more expensive but more options.
Minimum relative price for buy offers (ship sells TO stations). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: -0.5 (50% below average). Lower = cheaper buyers but more options.
Sell price max for isolated ships (stuck in single sector). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: 0.5.
Buy price min for isolated ships (stuck in single sector). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: -0.5.
Sell price max for fallback search (last resort when normal search fails). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: 0.5. Fallback search uses MaxDistance=2 and relaxed profit thresholds.
Buy price min for fallback search (last resort when normal search fails). Range: -1.0 to +1.0. Default: -0.5. Fallback search uses MaxDistance=2 and relaxed profit thresholds.

Base minimum profit at Level 15 for a medium trader (reference cargo 8200). Actual MinAbsoluteProfit is computed per pilot + scaled by cargo:

base(L) = Base * ((L-1)^2 / 14^2)
scaled = base(L) * (cargo / 8200)
final = max(scaled, 25% of base(L))

Set to 0 to accept any profit (only ROI/distance/other filters apply).
Maximum percentage ROI drop from cached value before rejecting trade. Example: 20% cached ROI with 15% tolerance accepts down to 17% ROI (14% drop).
Automatically blacklist all sectors owned by enemy factions (relation checkbox in blacklist)

Minimum threat level (1-5) required to blacklist a sector:
2=Medium (single attack)
3=Medium-High (hostile factions)
4=High (capital ships/missiles)
5=Very High (Xenon/Khaak)
Manually recreate the threat avoidance blacklist (useful if it was deleted)
Level 6+ traders detect hostile ships and avoid dangerous routes. Disabling stops all scanning (improves performance). Risk tolerance per ship in command behavior (0-10 scale).
Only flag factions with relation at or below this value as threats. Default: -20%
Automatically blacklist dangerous sectors (threat level 3+) to force ships to route around threats. Uses vanilla pathfinding for alternative routes.
Master Traders (Level 15) automatically restock defensive equipment after trades. Applies to commander level for subordinates.
All ships (S/M/L/XL). Separate capacity. Critical for missile defense.
L/XL ships only. Shares unified capacity with other deployables.
L/XL ships only. Essential for trading operations. Shares unified capacity.
All ships. L/XL ships share unified capacity, S/M use cargo.
L/XL ships only. Works with auto-repair system. Shares unified capacity.
Restock when countermeasures below this percentage (all ships, separate capacity).
Restock when total deployables below this percentage (L/XL ships: drones + towers share one capacity).

Distribution of unified capacity (L/XL ships): Trading-Focused (20/50/20/10), Balanced (35/35/20/10), Defensive (50/20/20/10), Heavy Defense (40/30/20/10), Tower Support (30/30/30/10). Ratios: Defense/Trade/Towers/Repair. Click to cycle through options.

Automatically install ship and engine modifications based on pilot level. Level 9+ = Level 1 mods, Level 12+ = Level 2 mods, Level 15+ = Level 3 mods. Only GT-installed mods are removed when order is cancelled.
Show XP values in ship names
Enable or disable automatic ship renaming with pilot information
Show rank titles in ship names
Show level numbers in ship names
Show trading status in ship names
Choose the source for ship base names: Model Name (with variant), Type Name (generic), Model Base (without variant), or Custom Name (stored name)
Show ship class (S, M, L, XL) in ship names
Master toggle for all debug_text output. When disabled, all debug logging is suppressed. When enabled, debug messages appear in the DebugLog based on individual debug_text chance values.

Removes all sectors from the threat intelligence blacklist. This will immediately clear all blacklisted sectors and allow your ships to travel to previously blocked areas. Use this if you want to reset the threat avoidance system or if sectors were incorrectly blacklisted.

Resets all profit statistics to 0 for all pilots and ships. Use this after upgrading to v0.6.0 to clear inflated revenue-based statistics. The fix now tracks actual PROFIT (revenue - purchase cost). Trade counts and XP are preserved.

Resets all global settings to their default values. This includes XP settings, Fleet Coordination, Notifications, Mobile Intel, Threat Avoidance, Ship Naming, Auto-Repair, Modifications, Performance, and Number Format settings. Debug logging setting is preserved to allow logging of the reset operation.
Clear Trade Cache for All Home Sectors:

Clears the trade cache for all home sectors. This will force all ships to perform fresh live searches on their next trade search. Use this if the cache appears stale or corrupted, or if you want to force a complete cache refresh.

Releases ALL in-flight trade-search locks and clears related transient state. Use this if ships are stuck on “Searching for trades” due to stale locks from old saves. This may interrupt legitimate searches.
Shows a one-shot snapshot of the centralized trade hub (scheduler queues + last requesting ship status) in the log and as a notification.
FULL cache dump (can be huge). Writes all cache entries to DebugLog in chunks. Click again to cancel.
Max Offers Per Ware For Matching:
Choose number format: German uses '.' for thousands and ',' for decimals (123.456,78), English uses ',' for thousands and '.' for decimals (123,456.78)
Enable M suffix for numbers greater than threshold (e.g., 1.0 M instead of 1,000,000)
Threshold for M suffix. Numbers above this value will be displayed with M suffix (default: 999,999)
Frequency of simple report (popup notification): 0-30 minutes (0 = disabled - simple reports are disabled, default: 1 minute)
Frequency of comprehensive report (logbook entry): 0-60 minutes (0 = disabled - comprehensive reports are disabled, default: 30 minutes)
Delay between batches during trade search processing (1-500ms). Higher values reduce CPU load but slow down trade searches. Default: 120ms. Used in batch processor and trade list filtering.
Delay between trade validations in AI script (1-500ms). Higher values reduce CPU load but slow down trade validation. Default: 50ms. Used when validating trade list from MD system.

Maximum number of trade searches that can run simultaneously (1-10). Lower values reduce CPU load but increase queue wait times. Higher values process searches faster but may cause performance spikes. Default: 1.

Maximum number of trades to return from cache search (1-100). Higher values provide more trade options but increase cache validation time. Lower values reduce CPU load but may miss viable trades. Default: 20.

Maximum number of offers per ware to process in live search (50-1000). Higher values consider more offers but increase processing time. Lower values reduce CPU load but may miss profitable trades. Default: 200.

Maximum number of trades per ware during batch processing (5-100). Higher values allow more trades per ware but increase processing time. Lower values reduce CPU load but may miss profitable trades. Default: 20.

Maximum number of offers per ware for matching in batch processor (5-100). Higher values consider more offers but increase processing time. Lower values reduce CPU load but may miss profitable trades. Default: 20.

Early exit threshold for batch processing (100-10000). When this many trades are found, batch processing stops early to save CPU. Higher values process more trades but increase CPU load. Lower values exit sooner but may miss profitable trades. Default: 2000.

Live offer slice interval in milliseconds (5-2000ms). Controls how often live offer slices can start. Lower values allow faster offer collection but increase CPU load. Higher values reduce CPU load but slow down live search processing. Default: 500ms.

Batch processing chunk size (5-20). Processes chunkSize×chunkSize combinations per chunk (e.g., 5×5 = 25 combinations). Larger chunks improve throughput but increase CPU load per chunk. Smaller chunks reduce CPU spikes but require more continuations. Default: 5.
Maximum number of cache searches that can run simultaneously (1-20). Cache searches are fast and cheap; lower values can reduce burstiness under huge fleets. Default: 2.

Maximum number of live searches that can run simultaneously (1-10). Live searches are CPU-intensive, so lower values reduce CPU load but increase queue wait times. Higher values process searches faster but may cause performance spikes. Default: 1.
Cache entries validated per chunk (10-200). Smaller values spread cache validation across more frames (smoother) but may increase time to find a cached trade. Default: 10.
Offers appended per append-slice (50-2000). Smaller values reduce per-frame list-append work (smoother) but may slow live search completion. Default: 200.

Search lock time-to-live in seconds (60-7200). If a ship is denied with "trade search already in progress" for longer than this, GT will self-heal by clearing stale search state and releasing the lock. Default: 600s.

Soft threshold for batch processor backlog (5-50). When backlog reaches this value, backpressure starts being applied to slow down new search requests. Lower values trigger backpressure sooner (more conservative). Default: 10.

Hard threshold for batch processor backlog (10-100). When backlog reaches this value, new live searches are blocked until backlog decreases. Lower values block searches sooner (more conservative). Default: 25.

Sectors processed per slice in live offer collection (1-5). Smaller values spread work across more frames (smoother) but may slow down offer collection. Larger values process faster but may cause frame spikes. Default: 1.

Cooldown after home-sector refresh completes (10-120 seconds). Prevents excessive refresh requests. Lower values allow more frequent refreshes but increase CPU load. Higher values reduce refresh frequency but may delay cache updates. Default: 30s.

Base cooldown after cache miss before retrying live search (1-30 seconds). Prevents excessive retry attempts. Lower values retry sooner but increase CPU load. Higher values reduce retry frequency but may delay trade finding. Default: 10s.

Interval between scheduler ticks in milliseconds (50-500ms). Controls how often the scheduler processes work queue. Lower values process more frequently but increase CPU load. Higher values reduce CPU load but may increase queue wait times. Default: 100ms.

Maximum cache queries started per scheduler tick (1-5). Limits cache query rate to prevent frame blocking. Lower values reduce CPU spikes but slow down cache searches. Higher values process faster but may cause stutter. Default: 1.

Maximum search continuations started per scheduler tick (1-5). Limits continuation rate to prevent frame blocking. Lower values reduce CPU spikes but slow down search processing. Higher values process faster but may cause stutter. Default: 1.

Maximum ships processed per scheduler tick (1-5). Limits ship processing rate to prevent frame blocking. Lower values reduce CPU spikes but slow down queue processing. Higher values process faster but may cause stutter. Default: 1.

Maximum work items processed per scheduler tick (1-5). Limits work item processing rate to prevent frame blocking. Lower values reduce CPU spikes but slow down queue processing. Higher values process faster but may cause stutter. Default: 1.

Maximum waiters woken per scheduler tick (1-10). Limits wake rate to prevent CPU spikes when many waiters are queued. Lower values reduce CPU spikes but slow down waiter processing. Higher values process faster but may cause stutter. Default: 2.

Maximum cache entries queried per batch (1-100). Controls cache query batch size. Lower values make cache searches faster but may miss better trades. Higher values consider more cached trades but increase validation time. Default: 5.

Live search state stale threshold in seconds (60-600). When live search state is older than this, it's considered stale and cleared. Lower values clear stale state sooner but may interrupt legitimate searches. Higher values allow longer searches but may leave stale state. Default: 300s.

Queue item stale threshold in seconds (30-300). When queue items are older than this, they're considered stale and removed. Lower values clear stale items sooner but may remove legitimate queued items. Higher values allow longer queue times but may leave stale items. Default: 60s.

Failed trade cache expiration in seconds (300-3600). Failed trades are cached to avoid retrying immediately. Lower values expire failed trades sooner (more retries) but reduce cache effectiveness. Higher values cache longer (fewer retries) but may delay retry attempts. Default: 1800s (30 minutes).

Maximum concurrent fallback live searches (1-10). Fallback searches bypass home-sector lock, allowing multiple ships from the same home sector to search simultaneously. Lower values reduce CPU load but may slow down fallback searches. Higher values allow more parallel fallback searches but increase CPU usage. Default: 1.
GalaxyTrader fleet management and pilot statistics
View and manage all GalaxyTrader pilots
Click to sort by Ship ID
Click to sort by Pilot Name
Click to sort by Ship Type
Click to sort by Lifetime Profit
Refresh pilot data from mission system
Export current view to CSV file
Create pilots by assigning ships to GalaxyTrader, or wait for data to load.
Engine modification that slightly reduces performance for inexperienced pilots on medium ships. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -5% speed, thrust and rotation.
Engine modification that slightly reduces travel performance for inexperienced pilots on medium ships. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -5% travel speed.
Engine modification that reduces performance for inexperienced pilots on large ships. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -15% speed, thrust and rotation.
Engine modification that reduces travel performance for inexperienced pilots on large ships. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -15% travel speed.
Engine modification that significantly reduces performance for inexperienced pilots on capital ships. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -25% speed, thrust and rotation.
Engine modification that significantly reduces travel performance for inexperienced pilots on capital ships. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -25% travel speed.
Specialized engine modification for small ships with basic certified pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +3% speed, thrust and rotation.
Specialized engine modification for small ships with basic certified pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +3% travel speed.
Specialized engine modification for large ships with basic certified pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -8% speed, thrust and rotation.
Specialized engine modification for large ships with basic certified pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -8% travel speed.
Specialized engine modification for capital ships with basic certified pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -15% speed, thrust and rotation.
Specialized engine modification for capital ships with basic certified pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. -15% travel speed.
Advanced engine modification for small ships with expert pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +25% speed, thrust and rotation.
Advanced engine modification for small ships with expert pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +25% travel speed.
Advanced engine modification for large ships with expert pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +15% speed, thrust and rotation.
Advanced engine modification for large ships with expert pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +15% travel speed.
Advanced engine modification for capital ships with expert pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +6% speed, thrust and rotation.
Advanced engine modification for capital ships with expert pilots. Used by GalaxyTrader AI system. +6% travel speed.

Severe Skill Limitation (Ship) - Represents severe performance penalties due to pilot inexperience with large vessels. Automatically applied by GalaxyTrader system when pilot skill is insufficient for ship size. Increases ship mass. (GT System Only - Not Available for Manual Installation)

Moderate Skill Limitation (Ship) - Represents moderate performance penalties as pilot adapts to vessel complexity. Automatically applied by GalaxyTrader system when pilot skill is insufficient for ship size. Increases ship mass. (GT System Only - Not Available for Manual Installation)

Light Skill Limitation (Ship) - Represents minor performance penalties during pilot skill development. Automatically applied by GalaxyTrader system when pilot skill is insufficient for ship size. Increases ship mass. (GT System Only - Not Available for Manual Installation)

Severe Skill Limitation (Engine) - Represents severe performance penalties due to pilot inexperience with large vessels. Automatically applied by GalaxyTrader system when pilot skill is insufficient for ship size. Reduces engine thrust and rotation. (GT System Only - Not Available for Manual Installation)

Moderate Skill Limitation (Engine) - Represents moderate performance penalties as pilot adapts to vessel complexity. Automatically applied by GalaxyTrader system when pilot skill is insufficient for ship size. Reduces engine thrust and rotation. (GT System Only - Not Available for Manual Installation)

Light Skill Limitation (Engine) - Represents minor performance penalties during pilot skill development. Automatically applied by GalaxyTrader system when pilot skill is insufficient for ship size. Reduces engine thrust and rotation. (GT System Only - Not Available for Manual Installation)
Customize ship state abbreviations. Default values are shown in input boxes and can be overridden. Maximum 3 characters. All ship names will automatically update when changed.
